name: The Suicide Machines - Destruction by Definition LP
description:
After 17 years this essential punk-ska classic is finally getting released on vinyl. Detroit's finest delivered 16 tracks of blisteringly fast, anthemic sing-a-longs and made this record the heir apparent to Operation Ivy's Energy, in terms of it's importance to fans of the genre. 

estimated pressing info
Black /White split - /100
Clear - /200
Red - /300
black - /400

name: The Suicide Machines - Battle Hymns LP
description:
Originally available as a super limited pressing in the late 90's, Battle Hymns, with its Iconic Sheppard Fairey cover art is back in print on vinyl! The Suicide Machines followed up their epic major label debut, with an even thrashier, harder edged, ska tinged classic record.... 22 songs, and only 4 coming in over 2 minutes long, this record is a must have in you ska-core collection!


estimated pressing info
Green/Gold  Split - /100
Coke Bottle Clear - /200
White - /300
Mixed Split Color- /400

options.name: mixed split color LP w/ Bonus 7"

name: The Mighty Mighty Bosstones - Lets Face It LP
description:
The smash hit record from the Kings of Ska-Core, available on vinyl for the first time in over 15 years! Featuring the abnds monster #1  hit "Impression that I Get" as well as "Royal Oil" and "Rascal King"

Due to licensing restrictions we are unable to ship this record outside of the United States.

estimated pressing #'s 

red/white split  - **fan club version** #'d out of 100
black/white split - /100
White - /300
black - /500

name: They Might Be Giants - John Henry 2xLP
description:
For the first time ever on vinyl, the 5th studio album from TMBG that documented the quirky rock kings  transition from a duo to a full blown band.  The album's name, a reference to the man versus machine fable of John Henry, is an allusion to the band's fundamental switch to more conventional instrumentation, especially the newly-established use of a human drummer instead of a drum machine. 

This album is a double LP packaged in a pretty sweet gatefold jacket, and is a total must have in your TMBG collection!

***due to licensing restrictions we cannot ship this record outside of the US/Canada***

name: They Might Be Giants - Factory Showroom LP
description:
After 15 years this classic album from Brooklyn's They Might Be Giants is finally getting a proper release on vinyl!!  This seriously overlooked gem in the TMBG catalog is the band's sixth overall release, and only the second to feature a full band... apparently it's Flansburgh's favorite record... and it's definitely one our all time favorites as well... and we could not be more stoked to be the label to finally reissue this amazing  album.

This item can only be shipped to US & Canada. Sorry!

name: Sum 41 - All Killer No Filler LP
description:
It would be a mistake to view Sum 41 as just another second-rate band cashing in on the early-'00s punk-pop boom, even if it did recruit Jerry Finn to produce All Killer No Filler. Just as Finn had done for both blink-182 and Green Day, he charges Sum 41's punk-pop with a razor-sharp edge, the sort of dynamic in-your-face sound that helps this music cross over to MTV and radio so well. Besides the notable production, a lot of credit should go to the band as well. Its songwriting is obviously more diverse here than it was a year earlier on its debut album, Half Hour of Power; for example, the group's rap and '80s metal influences rise to the surface more frequently here than on that first album and instill a fun sense of camp. "Fatlip" is perhaps the best example of how Sum 41 has made an effort to diversify the music with more than just power chords and melodic punk vocals.

Available for the first time ever on vinyl in North America, and contains the hit singles "Fat Lip" and "In Too Deep"

pressing info:

Black /150
Red / 180
White /308 (Shopradiocast Exclusive)
Blue   /557


****Due to licensing restrictions we can only ship this item to US addresses****

name: Double Exposure vol 2. - Allison Weiss & Jenny Owen Youngs 7"
description:
Allison & Jenny both come through with amazing Magnetic Fields covers on the second volume of our Double Exposure 7" series!
with Cover art by Leah Cooper (tarttoter.tumblr.com).


pressing info:
Black Vinyl - /100
Clear Vinyl - /400

name: Double Exposure Vol 1. - Franz Nicolay & Frank Turner 7"
description:
The first release in our new split 7" series where both contributing musicians will cover a song from the same artist.

We are extremely excited to announce  the debut release will feature  Franz Nicolay (of World Inferno/Friendship Society, The Hold Steady, Against Me! etc) and Frank Turner will cover songs by the English Playwrite/Composer/Singer Sir Noël Peirce Coward.

pressing info:

Black - /1000
Blue - /300
Red - /100
Clear - /100 (FEST EXCLUSIVE)

name: Ska Goes Solo Tour 7" (Less Than Jake / Catch 22 / ASOB)
description:
To celebrate the first (hopefully of many!) Ska Goes Solo tours we're issuing a special split single with Tracks from Chris DeMakes (of Less than Jake), Ryan Eldred (of Catch 22), and Jay Tea (of Arrogant Sons of Bitches)

for more info & tour dates go to www.skagoessolo.com/

*****PRE-ORDER This record will ship in January!!!*****

name: Pietasters - Oolooloo LP
description: Arguably the greatest soul/ska record ever produced. This classic Moon Ska release owes as much of its sound to Motown, as it does to Jamaica. The band perfected their sound on this record. It was before they had toured with the Mighty Mighty Bosstones and developed a slightly harder edge on their Hellcat releases. To this day, when the band plays live most of their set list is still dominated by songs from this album.

name: Suicide Machines - 2 Album Packs
description:
***This album is for pre-order - we expect it to ship in late august / early september***

So we put together some special packages for the release of these records for the collectors who want both (and both bonus 7"s) as well as some other cool items.

Here's a breakdown of the packages:


Both LPs + 7" - you get both Suicide Machine records + both bonus 7"!!!

:::::::and for serious hardcore collectors only:::::::

Fanboy pack - the rarest color of both records, both bonus 7"s, and test presses of both LPs, and both 7"s  (outside of the US please contact for shipping quote)


Super Fanboy pack - all 4 colors of both LP's, both bonus 7"s, and test presses of both LP, and 7" (outside of the US please contact for shipping quote)

name: The Skints - Ratatat 7"
description:
The US debut single from UK's The Skints! This 7" was previously only available as a bonus 7" with our Kickstarter reissue project.

1. Ratatat
2. Bright Girl
3. On a Mission Fatty Dread

name: Suicide Machines - Battle Hymns Bonus 7"
description:
2 unreleased tracks by Detroits own Suicide Machines!

1. I hate everything (featuring ICE-T)
2. whats the difference

name: Suicide Machines - Destruction Bonus 7"
description:
3 unreleased songs from one of the best ska-core acts ever!

1. 4
2. fadeaway
3. pack yer smiles

name: The Slackers - International War Criminal LP
description: This now out of print EP was issued by Thought Squad back in 2004, and is pretty much considered the band's turn to more "political" songs.  Containing fan favorite/live show mainstay tracks such as "Propaganda" and the title track "International War Criminal", this record remains a somewhat obscure release in an otherwise widely known catalog. While the tracks were eventually re-recorded for their album Peculiar (except for "Rider"), This ep contains all the original versions of the songs.  The vinyl reissue  also contains additional bonus tracks!

name: Stubborn All Stars - Back With a New Batch LP
description: This album (named Reggae Album of the year by Alternative Press) was pretty much the dream team of NYC ska artists. Skinnerbox's front man King Django assembled a team of musicians consisting of members of Rancid, Bosstones, Slackers, Toasters,etc, and the end result was one of the best records of the late 90's ska scene. Available for the first time ever on vinyl!

name: The Toasters - Don't Let the Bastards Grind You Down 2xLP
description: At the height of the third wave's popularity, the Toasters released this album, who's title track would see huge mainstream success, including a good deal of MTV airplay, as well as being used as the bumper music constantly for MTV programming. This  landmark record would also be the bands last release on Moon Ska before its demise, and it would be almost 5 years until the band would drop another album, this time on Megalith.  We couldn't be happier than to be a part of the reissue of this record, complete with a ton of unreleased bonus material from the same era!

name: Bruce Lee Band - S/T (Mike Park & Less than Jake)
description: This lost ska-punk masterpiece features a post Skankin' Pickle Mike Park (founder of Asian Man records) fronting Less than Jake. Easily one of the most overlooked gems of the 3rd wave ska scene. Available on vinyl for the first time in nearly 20 years!

name: Sammy Kay & The East Los Three - Love Letters
description:
The brand new full length from our buddy Sammy Kay, on Panic State records.  A beautiful mix of ska, reggae, and classic NJ style rock and roll, and featuring guest spots by members of The Slackers, and Stubborn All Stars.

Tracks
1.Love Letters
2.Second Avenue
3.Sweet Misery (2.0)
4.Pictures
5.Shes My Baby
6.Highs and Lows (feat Vic Ruggerio)
7.Paid My Dues
8.Baby You Lose
9.Old Man's Porch (feat David Hillyard & Mr. T Bone)
10.Eye of the Storm
11.Heart So True
12.One Trick Pony (feat King Django)
13.Lost in My Youth
14.I Can Change

name: Apple Stomp Posters!
description:
We have some leftover posters, If you missed the show, or just were too hammered to remember to grab one!

two options available:

name: Rudiments / Suicide Machines - FEST X PRESS!
description: We have a handful of these leftover from the madness that was Fest X in gainesville florida on black vinyl, limited to 100 copies, with a beautiful screened cover by Emily Bond.  Act fast, theres just a couple of these left!

name: Ska is Dead 7" Club Series II set (6 x 7")
description:
all 6 records are now available for the Ska is Dead club Series II

this set includes:

Vic Ruggiero / Chewing on Tinfoil
Pilfers / The Snails
Void Union / The Dropsteppers

get your set for some of the best established, and up anc coming ska acts in the country!

name: Asbestos CD clearance Sale - 10 for $10
description: we still have a bunch of CD's both from our label and our distro laying around, and we'd love for them to be heard & enjoyed... so we'll send you 10 different cds for the low low price of $10

name: Skalapalooza 2012 Screened Tour Print
description: we have some leftover tour prints left from our hugely successful innagural Skalapalooza tour!  Designed by Rob Dobi (yourscenesucks.com, howtodressemo, dobi.nu) and hand screened in 3 colors on a military green french paper, this huge (18x24) print is truly amazing.... get one while you still can! limited to 150 pieces.

name: Big D & The Kids Table - Salem Girls CD
description: a limited edition halloween themed EP put out by the band close a to a decade ago at this point, was limited to about 2000 copies, so grab one while you can!

name: Maker -S/T  CDEP
description:
****PRE-ORDER - Release Date is roughly November 13th****


Taking equal parts urgency and angst, Maker has
been weaving forceful and undeniably catchy songs
for the better part of 5 years now. Their latest EP,
simply entitled “Maker”, is a testament to their hard
work and dedication as songwriters and musicians.

The “Maker” EP is being released on November 13th
through Engineer records in the UK/Europe and will
be distributed in the U.S.A by Asbestos Records. This 5
song EP showcases the maturity they have been striving
to hit ever since they started Maker in a Massachusetts
basement some few years ago.

“Maker” is the follow up to last years critically
acclaimed full length “Mirrors”, which was released
on CD/Digital on 6131 records and on vinyl via Animal
Style records, respectively. They recorded this new
EP at Zing Studios in Westfield, MA with the help of
producer/engineer Eric Arena (A Day To Remember,
Farewell To Freeway, The Modern Day Saint) and Jim
Fogarty (The Devil Wears Prada, All That Remains,
Arrows Over Athens). They recently shot a video for
their first single “Shadows” with director Rob Soucy
(Make Do And Mend, Defeater, A Loss For Words) and
just finished up a UK tour with platinum recording
artist Hawthorne Heights. From November 16th-
December 23rd they are heading out on a full US tour
with Major League (No Sleep Records) and Turnover
(Run For Cover Records).

Maker has been known for their relentless touring
prowess and is poised to finally create their own niche
of Indie infused pop-punk and become a staple in the
music scene. With a slew of tours and releases under
their belt and armed with a new EP, Maker looks to be
sure that anyone and everyone will hear what they have
to say. Will you be listening?

name: River City Extension - and the Unmistakable Man 2xLP
description:
In late 2009 River City Extension hit the studio to record their first LP named The Unmistakable Man . The band along with Eric Sanderson of the Brooklyn based band Pela, spent the next few months working in the studio perfecting each song. The plan was to release an album that would allow the listener to experience a story from start to finish, whatever their interpretation would be. The Unmistakable Man delivers immense and precisec orchestration, and is reflective of their energetic live show, this music will stand the test of time. 

"Though from the Jersey Shore, River City Extension boasts a welcome worldly sound. Hints of the classic "Jersey Shore sound" (pioneered by Bruce Springsteen and Southside Johnny And The Asbury Jukes) color their songs, yet the band borrows liberally from Americana, mariachi, blues and calypso to create a compellingly distinct hybrid all their own."
- Alternative Press 

“Think of it like this: if Beck, The Avett Brothers, and the Sex Pistols got caught in a toxic ooze, mutating them into a single musical entity, you’d be left with River City Extension.” 
- Eastern Surf Magazine

"River City Extension sing about all the timeless things: religion, love and death, with just as much forlornness. As Joe Michelini dons his Christopher-Nolan’s-Joker-sings-Bright-Eyes voice and the rest of the 8 member troupe take up everything from trumpets to cellos, the group faces intense pressure to produce something emotional, something witty - something good."
- AbsolutePunk.net

"Singer, songwriter and de facto bandleader Joe Michelini conveys both the deeply personal and universal equally well in whispers and shrieks. Although he would likely shy away from the comparison, not since Springsteen's "The Wild, The Innocent and The E Street Shuffle" has a New Jersey songwriter written such a thrilling testimonial to youthful idealism-- victorious, romantic and majestic."
- Asbury Park Press

1st pressing
Black Viny l-  limited to 100 copies (mailorder only!)
White Vinyl - Limited to 400 copies

2nd pressing
Clear Vinyl with Black Smoke - limited to 100 copies
White w/Blue Smoke & Blue w/Black Smoke - limited to 400 copies

name: River City Extension - Don't Let the Sun Go Down on Your Anger 2xLP
description:
Something happens when these eight people come together. Put them on a stage, and something larger than even this relatively large band blossoms, ecstatic and cathartic and inspiring. And like the songs on River City Extension's second album, Don't Let the Sun Go Down On Your Anger, it may not hit you over the head from the first moment; rather, it's a journey. It sneaks up on you as these songs breathe and grow and change -- as apt a microcosm of life as any you'll find in music. 

"Half of this record is love songs, and the other half is 'I'm sorry that I fucked up' songs," says singer/songwriter/guitarist Joe Michelini. Such compellingly forthright new tunes as "If You Need Me Back In Brooklyn," "Slander," "Down, Down, Down" and "Point of Surrender" confront thorny issues of personal and spiritual struggle in a manner that's both intimate and illuminating, while the band drives home Michelini's hard-won lyrical insights with evocative arrangements that make inventive use of a wide range of instruments and sonic textures. 

This beautiful 2XLP comes in a gatefold jacket complete with poster insert! 

Pressing info:
Black 2xLP  /100
Clear 2xLP /400

name: Infamous Jake & The Pinstripe Mafia - This is the Beginning of the End LP
description: From 2000-2003, Infamous Jake & The Pinstripe Mafia dominated the Western Mass scene. Blending fast up-beat ska/punk with hardcore as well as some more traditional ska and reggae, the band soon gained prominence in the CT scene and quickly bonded with CT hardcore/ska/metal outfit The Flaming Tsunamis. The two bands were attached at the hip, touring together and even sharing members. Infamous Jake borrowed Joe Watts on trombone and TFT abducted Dan and Matt on trumpet and drums (respectively). Later Andy and Ethan of TFT would join forces with Dan and Matt to create Kill Normal Records which would release CDs for both bands as well as many others. The Beginning of the End marks the final album from this band, showcasing the their ever growing love of adding more aggressive elements into their ska/punk blend while still keeping a strong focus on melody. The album also features a cover of The Flaming Tsunamis’ PPC.

name: Suburban Legends - Rumpshaker LP
description: Most Ska bands that managed to get big did so largely based on the strength of their live shows and non stop touring. Santa Ana, California’s Suburban Legends took this to a whole new level in the years surrounding this release. Ridiculously complicated choreographed stage performances, and managing to play over 1000 sets in a single calendar year (performing over 960 shows: multiple sets a day at Disneyland, aside from their own rigorous touring schedule) is one hell of a way to show your dedication. If you've ever see them live, they get the crowd dancing just as hard as they are, and very few bands can even come close to their energy level. This record is the last to include Dallas Cook before he was sadly taken away from us.

name: Pilfers - S/T LP
description: Most supergroups are like the NFL probowl, tons of name recognition, but no real reason to pay any attention. This was absolutely not the case with NYC's Pilfers. Featuring ex-Toasters Coolie Ranx (who also managed to perform guest vox on seemingly every 3rd wave bands album in the late 90’s), Bim Skala Bim's Vinny Nobile on co-lead vocals and trombone, the rythm section from NYC's Skinnerbox: Anna Milat-Meyer, on bass & drummer James Blanck, and guitarist Nick Bacon from The Erratics. This band pioneered a reggae/ska/punk hybrid unlike anything that had come before. Their self released album is simply a masterpiece which stands as one of the brightest moments of the 90's Ska Revival, and the combination of two of the genre's most enigmatic frontmen made their live show unbelievable.

name: Edna's Goldfish - Before You Knew Better LP
description: In our opinion, hands down The Best ska album to come out of the Long Island scene in the 90's, and one of our personal favorite 3rd wave records period. This soulful super-dancey/pop ska record put them in a similar vein as CT's Spring Heeled Jack, and helped foster what would be an incredible local ska scene on the island that would influence such Asbestos Alumni as High School Football Heroes, Arrogant Sons of Bitches, Nix86 and tons of more bands. Though relatively unknown, possibly the most obscure of this batch of releases, the overall enthusiasm for this release held by the few and proud fans it did finds its way into their hearts remains as strong as ever to this day.

name: Rudiments / Jack Kevorkian & The Suicide Machines - Skank for Brains 2xLP
description:
Originally released back in 1995, this split came out as a somewhat infamous Beach Records compilation CD (with a few other random bands tacked onto the end) and later, legitimately, on Dill Records – it’s still a pretty legendary release if you ask us. The Rudiments were light years ahead of anyone else musically and hadn’t even yet reached their fullest potential; and the Suicide Machines were on the cusp of reaching their breakthrough moment leading to their now legendary status as well. The stars were lining up for both bands and this small document has been a beloved release for both labels involved and we wanted to wrestle this back from the brink of obscurity, shine it up and re-release it to the world. So we’re finally making that happen. It’s been mastered by Dave Eck at Lucky Lacquers and the cover art got a bit of remixing as well by the ever talented Todd S. Rogers. 
LP1: Rudiments

Wailing Paddle 
Monkey Grinder 
Treadmill 
Sunday Morning Suspect 
Spoon 
Plank 
Lucky Charms 
Scapegoat 
What's Cookin' 
Mamacita

LP2: the Suicide Machines

Hey Ska 
New Girl 
The Real You 
I Don't Wanna Hear It 
Too Much 
The Van Song 
Green World 
Inside/Outside 
Little Home 
Bonkers

name: FEST X - Drink Beer & Destroy! Coozie
description: leftover Asbestos Records beer coozies from FEST X in Gainesville! Great for keeping your beer cold, or your cell phone from being destroyed in your pocket at the show!

name: Spring Heeled Jack - SALE PACK!
description:
super special weekend sale!

a copy of both Static World View  & Songs from Suburbia on vinyl for only $25ppd*... thats almost half off!!


*free domestic shipping only!

name: Spring Heeled Jack - Static World View LP
description:
The full length debut from the one of the best 3rd wave ska bands from the northeast. Originally released on Moon Ska, this record would go on to be one of the label's biggest sellers. This would go on to be arguably the most important record to ever come out of the Connecticut Underground music scene. Featuring future members of The Mighty Mighty Bosstones, Reel Big Fish, Less than Jake, The Pilfers, Lost City Angels, and 2 Skinnee J's.

Available for the first time on vinyl with newly restored artwork and limited to 500 copies on black vinyl.

name: Spring Heeled Jack - Songs From Suburbia LP
description:
The 2nd and Final album from CT Ska Legends Spring Heeled Jack, featuring the hit single "Jolene". This was the album that brought the band to a national audience, and a great deal of acclaim.

Featuring future members of Less Than Jake, Reel Big Fish, and The Mighty Mighty Bosstones, and a guest appearance from Coolie Ranx of the Pilfers.

Available for the first time on vinyl, with  newly restored artwork, and limited to 500 copies.

name: Chewing on Tinfoil - Shaving CD <IMPORT>
description: Chewing on Tinfoil are five awesome guys from Dublin who have been helping out the DIY community over there for years. Plus, their first full length has that punk/ska/everythingelse vibe that Asian Man Records had in the 1990's, the kind of music that made kids all over the place realize they should be in bands. Hell yeah!

name: The NIX86 - Relate Reject Repeat CD
description:
Long Island based Ska-Rock super group featuring ex & current members of Bomb the Music Industry!, Arrogant Sons of Bitches, We Are the Union, Ednas' Goldfish, High School Football Heroes, The Flaming Tsunamis and many other local favorites. Their debut album comes off as the sonic offspring of bands such as Spring Heeled Jack,  Motion City Soundtrack, and New Found Glory.

Pre-Order - Ships Mid to Late OCTOBER

name: Andrew Jackson Jihad - Holiday In(n) Gainesville LP
description:
Recorded live on a four track in a hotel room at  the Holiday Inn during an afterparty on the last day of Fest 7.  Complete with crappy recording, tons of drunken heckling, and half assed attempts to keep the noise level down to avoid having security break up the show. 


Pressing info:
Black Vinyl    / 510
Red Vinyl   /347
White Vinyl    /110
Yellow Vinyl  /125 (100 of these had Fest Press screened covers)

name: Treephort - And the Streets will Run Red with the Blood of the Non Believers CD
description: 26 tracks of nerdcore madness. one of the east coast's most insane live acts comes thru with their latest release full of ska-core/pop punk/metal songs of the most ridiculous variety. this album is what you would get if you locked less than jake, the dead milkmen, alkaline trio, and system of a down in a small room and forced them to play a drunken game of strip poker. confused? see for yourselves then.

name: Treephort - Kill 'Em All CD
description: Back with their 6th album, Georgia's kings of the nerdcore scene return with all kindsa surprises. The CD shows a musical maturation for a band that's live show refuses to grow up. Complete with the single "You've Been Shopping In The Emo Dept" which landed in the top ten on MP3.com and the wonderfully ludicrous 80's balladry of "Good Things" Treephort has outdone themselves once again. P.S dont worry.. they still light themselves on fire, drink glue and blow shit up in their live show.

name: Sgt Scagnetti - The Discography (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD)
description:
Combining the quirky ska-core of bands like the Blue Meanies, with the frantic metal/circus rock of Mr. Bungle,Sgt. Scagnetti dominated the CT Ska scene of the late 90’s. Originally started as a pop ska band, the addition of front man Steve Lonergan led to the incarnation of the band that most were familiar with. With Steve at the helm the band’s music took a harder, more frantic turn employing lyrics filled with dysfunctional families, drug use and revenge fantasies, and with it the band rose to be one of the most popular underground bands in the state. 

Available for the fist time as a digital download: Sgt. Scagnetti - The Discography

24 Tracks including:
the Just Another Trick EP
DE:TO:NA:TE  CD
and the original version of Hellspawn from the Welcome to Skannecticut compilation.

(Note: you will receive an email with download code after ordering, code will be emailed to your paypal address if you don't specify a different address with your payment)

name: Tastes Like Burning.... Is Totally Decent! CD
description:
20 tracks of really quirky, keyboard heavy indie rock. To get a rough idea of what this record would sound like playing on your stereo please combine equal parts of Weezer's "Pinkerton" with The Dismberment Plan and stir in early They Might Be Giants B-sides..

Featuring members of Treephort, We Vs. the Shark, The Phenomenauts etc.

name: The Heat Machine - No Coast Dance Party LP
description:
Debut LP from Nebraska's hottest pop ska band! 

Pressing info:
Black Vinyl - /100
Red Vinyl - /400

name: Mustard Plug - Big Daddy Multitude LP+7"
description:
To Celebrate its 15th anniversary, Mustard Plug is reissuing this classic early Moon Ska release on vinyl for the very first time. Big Daddy Multitude was one of the best selling Moon albums, as well as the record that vaulted the Michigan based band to the forefront of the 90's ska explosion.

pressing info:
Black LP w/ Yellow 7" - /100
Clear LP w/ Black 7" - /125
White LP w/ White 7" - /250
Yellow LP w/ Black 7" - /500

name: Sonic Boom Six - Ruff Guide to Genre Terrorism LP
description:
On their US debut, Sonic Boom Six delivers an amazing combination of dancefloor-savvy reggae, jungle and ska with the rigorous commentary of hip-hop whilst retaining enough grit and aggression to be an active fixture of the UK’s punk scene.

pressing info:
White Vinyl - /100
Red Vinyl - /200
Yellow Vinyl - /300
Black Vinyl - /400

name: Sonic Boom Six - Ruff Guide to Genre Terrorism CD
description: On their US debut, Sonic Boom Six delivers an amazing combination of dancefloor-savvy reggae, jungle and ska with the rigorous commentary of hip-hop whilst retaining enough grit and aggression to be an active fixture of the UK’s punk scene.

name: The Flaming Tsunamis - Zombies vs. Robots LP
description: For nearly 7 years, The Flaming Tsunamis have been unleashing their explosive live show on the unsuspecting public. Playing everything from metal to reggae shows the band never ceases to shatter preconceptions of what a band with a horn section is capable of. Formed in rural Connecticut and starting out as a manic-paced skacore band, the group has since transformed into a much more experimental outfit that uses a framework of modern hardcore/metal to bring in such diverse influences as jazz, grind, ska, reggae, punk and anything else they can think of. Zombies vs Robots is being reissued just in time for this cult favorite's final shows... limited to 300 copies... get yours now.

name: The Flaming Tsunamis - Zombies vs Robots Fanboy Pack (2xLP)
description: For nearly 7 years, The Flaming Tsunamis have been unleashing their explosive live show on the unsuspecting public. Playing everything from metal to reggae shows the band never ceases to shatter preconceptions of what a band with a horn section is capable of. Formed in rural Connecticut and starting out as a manic-paced skacore band, the group has since transformed into a much more experimental outfit that uses a framework of modern hardcore/metal to bring in such diverse influences as jazz, grind, ska, reggae, punk and anything else they can think of. Zombies vs Robots is being reissued just in time for this cult favorite's final shows... limited to 100 sets... w/ hand screened sleeves, one featuring the Robot head, and one the Zombie.. on grey and green vinyl.

name: Tip the Van - Something Wicked CD
description: Debut full length from one of the northeast's biggest ska bands!

name: The Emotron - in the Decemberwrist CD
description: The one man synth punk sensation/horrifying performance artist known only as The Emotron delivers his debut full length, combining equal parts GG Allin, Atom and His Package, Horse the Band, and a huge dose of 80's new wave nostalgia into a 5" plastic disc for your listening pleasure.

name: Pegasuses XL - The Antiphon LP
description:
Featuring Mark Dale of Disband, Jeff Tobias of We Vs. The Shark and Dark Meat, Joel Hatstat of Cinemechanica, and Jeff Rosenstock of Bomb The Music Industry! Pegasuses-XL are a synth fueled punk rock experiment with nods to 90's hip-hop and Trans Am.

"The most punk rock dance party in the world" - Alternative Press

pressing info:
150 on White w/ Rainbow Splatter
350 on Black w/ white swirl

name: Bomb the Music Industry! - Album Minus Band LP
description: The long awaited Vinyl release of the now classic first BTMI! album. Out of the ashes of Long Island's Arrogant Sons of Bitches, this one man, home recorded project is now on vinyl!

name: Bomb the Music Industry! - To Leave or Die in Long Island LP
description:
This now classic MP3 only album available for a limited time on Vinyl. This album documents the experience of being a broke musician in Long Island and solidifies the signature Bomb the Music Industry! sound. Sing-alongs, drum machines, synthesizers, saxophones played faster than fuck. 

we found a handful of low numbered copies, and some random un-numbered copies in our storage area... get your 1st & 2nd press copies while you still can!

name: Bomb the Music Industry! - Goodbye Cool World LP
description: Call it whatever you want! Post-ska! Laptop punk! This is the long awaited "difficult third album" (to put it in billy bragg terms) from ex-Arrogant Sons of Bitches frontman, Jeff Rosenstock. Synthesizers! Horns! Guitars! (fake) Drums! No merchandise just rock! Available on limited edition vinyl for the first time!

name: Shine Some Light - A Benefit for Dan Lang-Gunn 2xCD
description: On November 19th 2004, Dan Lang-Gunn; Vocalist for Eyeball Records Artist, The Modern Day experienced arrhythmia and cardiac arrest shortly after a show began. Police and staff at the scene performed CPR until an emergency medical team arrived. Despite their quick response, Dan suffered from an anoxic brain injury. After spending many weeks in a coma, Dan now battles to regain his ability to walk, speak and live his everyday life. 100% of the proceeds of this 2 Disc Compilation goes to help Dan's family cover the costs of his hospitalization and rehabilitation.

name: Ska Punk Soundtracks 2xCD comp **Japanese Import**
description: A great 2 disc comp from Japan, featuring 40 Ska & Ska-punk bands, half from the US, half from Japan. Features songs by The Slackers, Mustard Plug, Big D, BTMI!, Tip the Van, We are the Union and lots more!

name: High School Football Heroes - We've Fool Around Long Enough CD
description: The Final full length from Long Island's High School Football Heroes.
